elements.title: XOXO, Tavi
elements.contents:

Today’s essential reads

XOXO, Tavi

Vanity Fair · 14 min

Fashion veteran, media mogul, Broadway actor, and star of the Gossip Girl reboot, Tavi Gevinson—famous for more than half of her life—shows no signs of scaling back her ambitions.

How to Gracefully Turn Down Plans You Can’t Afford

The Cut · 7 min

The Devil Wears Prada and the Myth of the One and Only "Big Break"

Harper's Bazaar · 4 min

Aliens Might Already Be Watching Us

Scientific American · 7 min

How to Store Berries So They Stay Fresher Longer

Bon Appétit · 3 min

Fascinating stories

To Tell Someone They’re Wrong, First Tell Them They’re Right

Quartz · 3 min

A philosopher’s 350-year-old trick to get people to change their minds is now backed up by psychologists.

The Key To Flirting? It's Not About You

NPR · 6 min

Everyone's talking about having a "hot vax summer," but what if you're instead bracing for a "lukewarm return to awkward chit chat with people you find attractive?"

What Kind of Burnt Out Are You? (And Why It Matters)

Lifehacker · 4 min

Different types of burnout require different solutions.

How to Use a Foam Roller

Apartment Therapy · 4 min

This therapeutic tool will change your life.

Did a Cuttlefish Write This?

The New York Times · 11 min

Octopuses and squid are full of cephalopod character. But more scientists are making the case that cuttlefish hold the key to unlocking evolutionary secrets about intelligence.

Unlocking the ‘gut microbiome’ – and its massive significance to our health

The Guardian · 13 min

Scientists are only just discovering the enormous impact of our gut health – and how it could hold the key to everything from tackling obesity to overcoming anxiety and boosting immunity.

How One McDonald’s Employee Took Down a $24M Scam

Elle · 5 min

Sandwiches to pack for a picnic this summer

Los Angeles Times · 3 min

The Pop Music You Listen to Really Does Matter

The Atlantic · 10 min

Being in Time

The New Yorker · 18 min

Start your library

How Not to Care When People Don’t Like You

Lifehacker · 9 min

Everyone is disliked by someone. Don’t let it slow you down.

Failure to Launch: Why Jetpacks Never Took Off

Sports Illustrated · 19 min

When Willy Suitor strapped into a rocket belt and soared through the air at Super Bowl I, it wasn't hard to imagine that we would all be flying around someday. But the jetpack future we were promised never came to be.

Zaila Avant-garde won the national spelling bee, but that wasn’t her first real victory

theundefeated.com · 3 min

Whether dribbling a basketball, breaking juggling records or identifying obscure Latin or Greek words, Zaila Avant-garde shows no stress under pressure. She has the ultimate poker face.

How to Achieve Sustainable Remote Work

The New Yorker · 15 min

Companies must move away from surveillance and visible busyness, and toward defined outcomes and trust.

I Tried These 8 Sleep Tricks, Here’s What Worked (And What Didn’t)

Domino · 6 min

The tips that finally led me to a better night’s rest.
